Banana Wars.Objective: To enforce United States and private interests in Central America and the Caribbean

Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Panama_Colombia: Interventions during the construction of the Panama Canal, Panama's secession from Colombia in 1903 with U.S. backing.
Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Spanish-American_War: End of war in 1898 marked the beginning of Banana Wars.
Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Cuba: Multiple U.S. occupations, Cuba under U.S. control as per the Cuban–American Treaty of Relations until 1934.
Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Dominican_Republic: U.S. actions in 1903, 1904, 1914, and occupation from 1916 to 1924.
Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Nicaragua: Occupied almost continuously by the U.S. from 1912 to 1933.
Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Mexico: Border War from 1910 to 1919 and the occupation of Veracruz in 1914.
Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Haiti: Occupied by the U.S. from 1915 to 1934, leading to new constitution allowing foreign land ownership.
Key_Conflicts_and_Events.Honduras: American troops inserted several times between 1903 and 1925 due to banana export sector influence.

Policies_and_Doctrines.Roosevelt_Corollary: Asserted the right of the U.S. to intervene in the economic affairs of neighboring countries.
Policies_and_Doctrines.Dollar_Diplomacy: Taft's policy of using economic power and influence backed by military force.
